subject: Learning
title: Critical Periods: Is It Too Late to Learn?
description: A micro-lesson that makes Critical Periods: Is It Too Late to Learn? usable.

hook.text: Miss the 'window' for language before age 5 and you'll never learn one. Right? Mostly wrong.

buildup.text: Critical periods are time windows when the brain is especially receptive to certain types of input.

discovery.text: They exist for basic vision and first-language grammar, but most skills have sensitive periods, not cutoffs.

twist.text: Adults learn second languages, instruments, and complex skills daily. It's harder, but far from impossible.

climax.text: Neuroplasticity continues throughout life. The brain is slower to change, but it never stops.

punchline.text: Windows narrow. They rarely close completely.

quiz.question: What is the difference between critical and sensitive periods?
options: Critical periods have hard cutoffs; sensitive periods make learning harder but not impossible
There is no difference between them
Sensitive periods end before critical periods
